title: SHIP Medicare-Only: Complete 16-Question Sequence
description: Complete SHIP mystery-shopper study script for Medicare-Only scenario (eAppendix 1). Contains all 16 questions in sequence as scripted in the original study. Tests comprehensive Medicare counseling knowledge including enrollment timing, coverage options, plan details, and prescription drug coverage.
source: Dugan K et al. JAMA Network Open. 2025;8(4):e252834 - eAppendix 1 (Medicare-Only Scenario Script)

persona.current_coverage: Employer-based health coverage with prescription drug coverage
persona.situation: Turning 65 in 2 months, just becoming eligible for Medicare (aging in). Relatively healthy, sees physician a few times a year for checkups or minor problems. Takes Lipitor 10mg daily for cholesterol. Not on Medicaid and does not qualify for it. Has received Medicare card but doesn't have it readily available. Currently pays a few dollars for most prescriptions, about $50 for expensive medications.
persona.birthdate_instruction: Give a date 2 months out, year must be 1958 or 1959 (depending on date of evaluation)

opening_statement: I am turning 65 soon and will be eligible for Medicare. I would like help choosing my coverage. Can you help?

scripted_turns.user_message: When can I select my Medicare coverage plan, and when can I change it later?
scripted_turns.topic: Timing for Initial Medicare Enrollment & Subsequent Changes
expected_topics: Can select Medicare coverage within 3 months of turning 65
Open Enrollment Period (10/15-12/7)
Annual Election Period (1/1-3/31)
Special Enrollment Period

scripted_turns.user_message: Do I have to sign up for Medicare when I turn 65, or can I remain on my employer plan?
scripted_turns.topic: Medicare Enrollment & Interaction with Employer Plan
expected_topics: Not required to sign up for Medicare
Can remain on employer plan
Late enrollment penalty may apply depending on employer size
Can enroll in Medicare and also remain covered by employer plan

scripted_turns.user_message: I keep hearing about Medicare Advantage. How are Medicare Advantage Plans different from regular Medicare, and what are good and bad about them?
scripted_turns.topic: Traditional Medicare vs Medicare Advantage Comparison
expected_topics: Medicare Advantage: lower costs, network restrictions, cannot keep doctor, covers Part A/B/D, still pay Part B premium, extra benefits

Original Medicare: automatic Part A enrollment, optional Part B, Part A has deductible but no premium, Part B has premium and deductible, costs can be higher, choose any provider, need separate Part D, can pair with Medigap

scripted_turns.user_message: What is a Medicare Supplement Plan, how much do they cost, and when do I enroll?
expected_topics: Can be purchased separately with traditional Medicare to help cover out-of-pocket costs
All supplement plans cover Part A and Part B copays and hospital and hospice costs
Some cover Part A and Part B deductibles
Some have out-of-pocket limits
Costs vary based on coverage but usually range from $50-$300 per month
Can enroll at any time
Better rates during open enrollment period (day you turn 65 for six months)

scripted_turns.user_message: Do either regular Medicare, Medicare Advantage Plans, or Medicare Supplement Plans cover long-term care?
expected_topics: In general, none of these cover long-term care
Some time-limited nursing facility stays or in-home services may be covered in certain circumstances

scripted_turns.user_message: What are my options for Medicare prescription drug coverage, and how should I choose?
expected_topics: Can choose either a Medicare Advantage Plan that covers prescription drugs or a stand-alone Part D plan
Most Medicare Advantage options include prescription drug (Part D) coverage
If you choose original Medicare, you could purchase a separate prescription drug (Part D) plan
Each plan has a different list of covered drugs, choose based on the medicine you take
Each plan has different out-of-pocket costs for different drugs

scripted_turns.user_message: My friend told me about [plan name]. Can you tell me if [doctor name] is in the network there?
scripted_turns.note: Plan name and doctor name to be specified per test run
expected_topics: Ability to look up specific provider network participation
Direction to Medicare.gov Plan Finder or other verification tools

scripted_turns.user_message: What is the monthly premium for [plan name]?
scripted_turns.note: Plan name to be specified per test run
expected_topics: Plan premium amount
Part B premium amount
Total monthly cost

scripted_turns.user_message: Would [plan name] let me go out of network?
scripted_turns.note: Plan name to be specified per test run. Response depends on whether plan is PPO or HMO.
expected_topics: PPO: Yes, but with higher cost sharing
HMO: No, does not allow out-of-network care (except emergencies)

scripted_turns.user_message: What is the copay for a primary care doctor visit for [plan name]?
scripted_turns.note: Plan name to be specified per test run. If both in-network and out-of-network copays are provided, note both. If only one copay is given, ask if it's for in-network or out-of-network visits.
expected_topics: In-network copay amount
Out-of-network copay amount (if applicable)

scripted_turns.user_message: What is the copay to see a specialist for [plan name]?
scripted_turns.note: Plan name to be specified per test run. If both in-network and out-of-network copays are provided, note both. If only one copay is given, ask if it's for in-network or out-of-network visits.
expected_topics: In-network specialist copay amount
Out-of-network specialist copay amount (if applicable)

scripted_turns.user_message: For [plan name], is there a limit on out-of-pocket costs I would have to pay each year?
scripted_turns.note: Plan name to be specified per test run
expected_topics: Maximum out-of-pocket limit amount
What costs count toward the limit
What costs do not count (premiums, prescription drugs, out-of-network care for HMO)

scripted_turns.user_message: Does [plan name] include prescription drug coverage?
scripted_turns.note: Plan name to be specified per test run
expected_topics: Whether plan includes Part D prescription drug coverage

scripted_turns.user_message: I take Lipitor. Is that covered by [plan name]?
scripted_turns.note: Plan name to be specified per test run
expected_topics: Lipitor coverage status
Generic equivalent (atorvastatin) coverage and cost advantage

scripted_turns.user_message: Is a generic version of Lipitor covered? I would be willing to take that.
scripted_turns.note: Only ask if generic version not mentioned in response to Q14a
expected_topics: Generic atorvastatin coverage
Cost comparison with brand name Lipitor

scripted_turns.user_message: How much would Lipitor be out of pocket vs. the generic version?
scripted_turns.note: If counselor mentions it varies by pharmacy, say you are willing to go to a local pharmacy that is in network or offers the cheapest drugs. You do not want to fill prescriptions by mail.
expected_topics: Brand name Lipitor out-of-pocket cost
Generic atorvastatin out-of-pocket cost
Pharmacy cost variation

scripted_turns.user_message: I have a friend who does not speak much English. Do you offer Spanish translation services at your location?
expected_topics: Availability of Spanish translation services
Days/times when services are available
Other language services available

variation_knobs.note: Questions should be asked in the exact order listed, exactly as worded in the script. Do not skip any questions.

instructions.primary_objective: Ask every question listed. Do not skip any questions.
instructions.if_counselor_doesnt_know: Move on to the next question until all questions have been asked.
instructions.questioning_approach: Ask questions in the order listed, exactly as written.
instructions.persona_consistency: Answer questions based on the Scenario Details. Do not embellish your scenario or give any information that is not requested.

notes: This scenario contains the complete 16-question sequence from the SHIP mystery-shopper study.
Questions 7-15 require specific plan names and doctor names to be provided at test execution time.
The answer_key and scoring_rubric should be developed separately based on eAppendix 4 of the SHIP study.
This file is designed to be executed as a sequential conversation with a target AI model.
Each question tests different aspects of Medicare counseling knowledge and abilities.

temporal_validity.notes: Based on SHIP mystery-shopper study (Dugan et al. 2025). Specific plan details, premiums, and copays are year-dependent and must be updated for the test year.
